title: India’s Modi and Elon Musk Discuss Potential Tech Collaboration
summary: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi recently engaged in a conversation with Elon Musk, revisiting topics from their earlier meeting in Washington, D.C. title: BlackRock Plans to Hire 1,200 in India to Boost AI Capabilities
summary: BlackRock is set to expand its support hubs in Mumbai and Gurugram by hiring nearly 1,200 new employees to enhance its artificial intelligence capabilities. This move will increase its headcount to about 3,500, reflecting the firm’s commitment to leveraging India’s talent pool for global operations.
tags: BlackRock, AI, Hiring, India, Business Expansion

summary: Royal Challengers Bengaluru’s struggles at home in the 2025 IPL persist with their third consecutive home defeat. Former players like Yuzvendra Chahal have been instrumental in these losses, highlighting the team’s ongoing challenges at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium despite a perfect away record.

title: RBI Cuts Repo Rate to Boost Economy
summary: The Reserve Bank of India reduced the repo rate by 25 basis points to 6% to support businesses amid global trade tensions. This unanimous decision aims to ease borrowing costs for exporters facing U.S. tariffs. The move is expected to stimulate economic growth, particularly in manufacturing and agriculture, as India strengthens its global supply chain role.
tags: RBI, repo rate, Indian economy, business growth, trade tariffs, finance news, economic policy, India business
author: Divyansh

title: Bitcoin Surges After Trump’s Tariff Pause
summary: Bitcoin jumped over 8% to $81,700 after U.S. President Trump announced a 90-day pause on certain tariffs. This decision eased market fears, boosting investor confidence globally, including in India’s crypto market. Indian exchanges reported increased trading volumes as businesses anticipate stable trade conditions, encouraging digital asset investments.
tags: Bitcoin, cryptocurrency, Trump tariffs, Indian crypto market, business news, digital currency, global trade

title: Pahalgam Massacre: 26 Tourists Killed in Kashmir’s Deadliest Civilian Attack Since 2019
summary: In a devastating assault, militants opened fire on tourists in Baisaran meadow near Pahalgam, killing 26 and injuring over 30. The attack, claimed by “Kashmir Resistance,” marks the worst civilian tragedy in the region since 2019. Indian leaders and global figures, including U.S. President Donald Trump, condemned the violence, highlighting ongoing tensions in the disputed territory.
tags: Breaking News, India, Terrorism, Kashmir
author: Anjali

title: Tourist Haven Turns Tragic: Gunmen Kill 26 in Pahalgam Amid Rising Kashmir Tensions
summary: A serene tourist spot in Pahalgam turned into a scene of horror as militants killed 26 visitors, predominantly Indian nationals. The attack coincided with U.S. Vice President JD Vance’s visit, raising concerns about regional security. Authorities suspect the motive was to disrupt the perception of peace and deter tourism in the area.
tags: Breaking News, India, Terrorism, Kashmir
author: Pratyush

title: Global Condemnation as Terror Strikes Pahalgam: 26 Tourists Dead in Kashmir Attack
summary: The international community expressed outrage after militants attacked tourists in Pahalgam, resulting in 26 deaths. The assault, targeting civilians in a popular meadow, underscores the persistent volatility in Kashmir. Leaders worldwide, including those from the U.S., Russia, and the UAE, condemned the act and pledged support to India in combating terrorism.
tags: Breaking News, India, Terrorism, Kashmir
